Sentencas: Assessment of mechanical properties of glass/metal joints is a challenging process, especially when the application relevant conditions of the joints have to be considered in the test design.
Titulo: Finite element optimization of sample geometry for measuring the torsional shear strength of glass/metal joints

Sentencas: In this study, a finite element method (FEM) is implemented to analyze a torsional shear strength test designed for glass-ceramic/steel joints aiming towards solid oxide fuel/electrolysis cells application.
Titulo: Finite element optimization of sample geometry for measuring the torsional shear strength of glass/metal joints

Sentencas: Deviations from axial symmetry of the square flanges (ends) of respective hourglass-shaped specimens and also supporting and loading sockets of the test setup are included in the model to simulate conditions close to reality.
Titulo: Finite element optimization of sample geometry for measuring the torsional shear strength of glass/metal joints

Sentencas: Undesirable tensile stress and also shear stress concentration appear at the outer edge of glass-ceramic layers, which are less for the hollow-full specimen.
Titulo: Finite element optimization of sample geometry for measuring the torsional shear strength of glass/metal joints

Sentencas: The simulation results show that for a specimen with either 9 mm thick square- or 6 mm thick triangular-flanges, locally enhanced tensile stresses almost disappear, resulting in a symmetric shear stress distribution.
Titulo: Finite element optimization of sample geometry for measuring the torsional shear strength of glass/metal joints

Sentencas: The difference between the analytically derived nominal shear strength and the real critical shear stress derived via simulation reduces with decreasing the fracture torque.
Titulo: Finite element optimization of sample geometry for measuring the torsional shear strength of glass/metal joints
